There was a moderate accumulation of excreta observed in the back areas and along the inside fence lines of the goat
enclosures, and underneath and within the cracks of the wooden enrichment furniture provided for the animals. Although
the facility has a regular cleaning schedule in place, additional cleaning of the animal pens is needed. The presence of
accumulated excreta can increase disease hazards in animal areas. Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures
as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to
reduce odors.
To be corrected by September 17, 2024

An overgrown tree located in the pasture is hanging over and laying on top of the roof of the male goat pens. A section of
the structure, approximately 2 feet X 1 foot, is in disrepair as the wooden trim has rotted out and the corrugated metal roof
above it has become detached. The remaining painted wood trim along the front of the roof is peeling away. There is an
accumulation of dust, debris, and cobwebs on a shelf adjacent to the sink used for cleaning animal receptacles, and
cobwebs are present on the ceilings of a utility room where hay is stored. Regular housekeeping of buildings and grounds
should be scheduled to minimize potential health and injury hazards to the animals. Premises (buildings and grounds)
shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate the prescribed husbandry
practices set forth in this subpart.
To be corrected by October 15,2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
